alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 19 at 4:19AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves will build to 6 to 9 feet with local sets to 10 feet today, continue through Friday, then slowly subside Friday afternoon and evening. There is a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Fri evening. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches. Nuisance to minor coastal flooding is possible around the high tide near noon today, with slightly less of a chance early Friday afternoon.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.
